Oasis & CDP-related TXs dominated TX volume in 2018, but DeFi is making a dent, see @compoundfinance and @dydxprotocol doing ~5% and ~1% of volume in Jan 2019pic.twitter.com/yuaJAKTg9A

1101908841774678016.text: 7/ $DAI daily active addresses up from ~100 to 735 on average in the first 3 wks of Jan 2019. Transaction counts up at a similar rate to ~3K daily or around 4 daily TXs per daily active address. Daily $DAI velocity down to 0.1 from 1, but still quite highpic.twitter.com/VCkuEC1R3p

1101908840508018688.text: 6/ More than 500 $MKR burned from stability fees. If liquidation fees had gone to burning $MKR (as they will in MCD), these would have been 20X higher than stability fees. Unpaid (latent) stability fees were an additional ~650 $MKR as of writingpic.twitter.com/qwHQ5eEpEA

1101908838343761920.text: 5/ Keepers have been biting CDPs very close to the maximum of 150% (~149%, on average). Only 4 CDPs have slipped through 140%, making up a mere ~$340 in debt. Not a single toxic CDP, despite a >90% decline in ETH pricepic.twitter.com/yG64n1hIzM

1101908836645027840.text: 4/ Over 2K liquidations in 2018, with smaller CDPs more prone to getting bitten. Keepers made over $1.4M in discounts on gas costs of just ~$25K. Room for more competition?pic.twitter.com/ulP09zEp9l

1101908834925322240.text: 3/Growth in $DAI has been driven by the opening of new CDPs. There were 2.5K active CDPs by Feb 7, with an average age of 3mos. While initially strongly correlated, ETH price and coll ratio have largely decoupled. Despite extreme ETH vol, daily coll ratio never dropped below 217%pic.twitter.com/Oo4ePOAC71

1101908833188933632.text: 2/ Both average and median CDP are getting smaller, but debt is still concentrated in a small number of "whale" CDPs (average is 60X the median)pic.twitter.com/eiGnDx5lfP

1101908830814945281.text: 1/ Nearly $250 in cumulative debt issued by Feb 7th 2019. $DAI outstanding grew to $90m & locked PETH to over 2M (~2% of all ETH). Drops in $DAI supply have coincided with heightened liquidations (compare to Bites line in 1A)pic.twitter.com/akQFA5bAWR

1013830825064960001.text: TL;DR the original post from 6 mos ago has gathered significant dust. What I enjoy about each of these pieces is that their criticisms serve as starting points for new approaches. These can, in turn, be criticized & improved to the benefit of our collective understanding.

1013830822670061570.text: .@m_eust wrote this great piece using Sraffa's concept of Own-Rates to drill deeper on the interest rate component of these models: https://entropy.party/2018/05/22/CryptoInterestRates.html …

1013830821671776258.text: .@sall recently published an extension using Queuing Theory (which @JohnnyAntos also briefly discusses):https://medium.com/@sall/valuing-cryptoassets-from-the-ground-up-441ad5a9ff03 …

1013830820665151488.text: Another critical review worth re-surfacing was written by Tommy Hall, extending the framework to multiple users:https://medium.com/@tommylhall/utility-token-valuation-model-tsla-8e54457db996 …

1013830819042025474.text: Great two-part series by @JohnnyAntos constructively criticizing & extending the Baumol-Tobin model adaptation, first introduced here: https://medium.com/blockchannel/on-value-velocity-and-monetary-theory-a-new-approach-to-cryptoasset-valuations-32c9b22e3b6f … …https://twitter.com/JohnnyAntos/status/1013804010002878469 …

1002222451282063361.text: Super excited to have joined @jmonegro @cburniske @mlaultc & @BradUSV at @placeholdervc. Wrote a short intro here:https://twitter.com/placeholdervc/status/1002216891446976512 …

960548759296991232.text: For those curious about the theoretical background here, I would recommend this (slightly dated) discussion of velocity in monetary economics: https://www.kansascityfed.org/PUBLICAT/ECONREV/EconRevArchive/1978/2q78higg.pdf …https://twitter.com/cburniske/status/959818131815280640 …

Many thanks to @Steven_McKie and @ecoinomia for their helphttps://medium.com/blockchannel/on-value-velocity-and-monetary-theory-a-new-approach-to-cryptoasset-valuations-32c9b22e3b6f …

952681650420355072.text: MV=PQ is an identity, not a theory. It is true by definition, much like “assets equals liabilities” or “price is determined by demand and supply.” It only “works” as well as the assumptions you make about the variables.https://twitter.com/coinfund_al/status/952645817806049280 …

891112965650472963.text: 6/ These will almost exclusively be subscription-based and will regularly deliver relevant, valuable local content to their communities.

891112328804126720.text: 5/ There is a wide-open opportunity to build trusted, high-quality local news publications.

891111356690292736.text: 4/ The trust vacuum is being filled with a cesspool of fake and hyperpartisan content.

891110606807478273.text: 3/ Decline of local news is a HUGE problem as it's a key source of trust. News that is relevant to everyday/lived experience is trusted.

891109320494129156.text: 2/ Got me thinking about this piece https://stratechery.com/2017/the-local-news-business-model/ …. Subscription business models are a huge opp for local news orgs.

891108714979217408.text: 1/ Great stuff. Subscription news businesses have unique needs and few understand those better than @theinformation. https://www.theinformation.com/announcing-the-information-accelerator …
